### Recent Releases

<!-- RECENT_RELEASES -->
<ul>
<li>
  <strong>2026-01-31</strong> – <a href="https://github.com/insin/control-panel-for-youtube">control-panel-for-youtube</a> <a href="https://github.com/insin/control-panel-for-youtube/releases/tag/v1.29.0">v1.29.0</a>
  <div><em>Browser extension which gives you more control over YouTube by adding missing options and UI improvements - for desktop &amp; mobile browsers</em></div>
  <details><summary>v1.29.0 release notes</summary><p>Visit the <a href="https://soitis.dev/control-panel-for-youtube" rel="nofollow">Control Panel for YouTube website</a> for installation links, more information about the extension, and FAQs (mostly about Safari).</p>
<p>Follow <a href="https://bsky.app/profile/soitis.dev" rel="nofollow">@soitis.dev</a> on Bluesky or <a href="https://twitter.com/ControlPanelFT" rel="nofollow">@ControlPanelFT</a> on Twitter for updates.</p>
<h2>Changes</h2>
<ul>
<li>Added an option to hide low view (&lt; 1000) videos in Related</li>
<li>Added a new "Extra small" size option for Search thumbnails on desktop</li>
<li>Updated the option which restores the normal Related sidebar layout on desktop to also revert the 2 column and wide variants</li>
<li>Fixed the restored Upload date filter in Search on desktop causing a full page reload</li>
<li>Fixed adding another Upload date filter when the current user still has the old Sort by filters in Search on desktop</li>
<li>Renamed the "YouTube experiments" option group to "Recent YouTube changes", as these didn't end up just being A/B tests as expected</li>
</ul>
<h2>Availability (3/5)</h2>
<p>New versions have to be reviewed and approved for each browser before they're available to install or upgrade to.</p>
<p>This version is available for the following browsers:</p>
<p><a href="https://apps.apple.com/app/id6478456678?platform=mac" title="Safari on macOS" rel="nofollow"><img <h3>Fixed restored Upload date filter causing a full page reload</h3>
<p>e.g. if you have the miniplayer open, it should no longer be dismissed</p>
<details open="" class="details-reset border rounded-2">
  <summary class="px-3 py-2">

<li>
  <strong>2026-01-22</strong> – <a href="https://github.com/insin/control-panel-for-twitter">control-panel-for-twitter</a> <a href="https://github.com/insin/control-panel-for-twitter/releases/tag/v4.20.0">v4.20.0</a>
  <div><em>Browser extension which gives you more control over your Twitter timeline and adds missing features and UI improvements - for desktop and mobile</em></div>
  <details><summary>v4.20.0 release notes</summary><p>Visit the <a href="https://soitis.dev/control-panel-for-twitter" rel="nofollow">Control Panel for Twitter website</a> for installation links, more information about the extension, and FAQs (mostly about why Safari is so weird about extensions).</p>
<p>Follow <a href="https://twitter.com/ControlPanelFT" rel="nofollow">@ControlPanelFT</a> on Twitter or <a href="https://bsky.app/profile/soitis.dev" rel="nofollow">@soitis.dev</a> on Bluesky for updates.</p>
<h2>Changes</h2>
<ul>
<li>Added an option to show the account location in user hover cards on desktop (default: enabled)</li>
<li>Fixed "undefined?" being added to focused Tweets for accounts without a detected location</li>
<li>Fixed other interaction links not also being added to focused Tweets by default</li>
<li>Fixed the Chat notification count being replaced with "Messages" when redirecting Chat to Messages on desktop</li>
</ul>
<h2>Availability (5/5)</h2>

<li>
  <strong>2026-01-13</strong> – <a href="https://github.com/insin/tailwindcss-axes">tailwindcss-axes</a> <a href="https://github.com/insin/tailwindcss-axes/releases/tag/v2.0.0">v2.0.0</a>
  <div><em>A Tailwind CSS plugin which adds main-axis-* and cross-axis-* utilities for flexbox alignment</em></div>
  <details><summary>v2.0.0 release notes</summary><h2>Breaking</h2>
<ul>
<li>Changed <code>tailwindcss</code> peerDependency from <code>"&gt;=3.0.0 || insiders || &gt;=4.0.0-alpha.20"</code> to <code>"&gt;=3.0.0 || &gt;=4.0.0"</code></li>
<li>Removed <code>cross-axis-first-baseline</code> as it does the same thing as <code>cross-axis-baseline</code></li>
<li>Renamed <code>cross-axis-last-baseline</code> to <code>cross-axis-baseline-last</code> to match Tailwind v4</li>
</ul>
<h2>New</h2>
<ul>
<li>Added <code>main-axis-end-safe</code>, <code>main-axis-center-safe</code>, <code>main-axis-baseline</code>, <code>cross-axis-end-safe</code>, and <code>cross-axis-center-safe</code> to match Tailwind v4</li>
</ul></details>
</li>
<li>
  <strong>2025-06-16</strong> – <a href="https://github.com/insin/ai-overview-hider-for-google">ai-overview-hider-for-google</a> <a href="https://github.com/insin/ai-overview-hider-for-google/releases/tag/v1.0.9">v1.0.9</a>
  <div><em>Browser extension which hides the AI Overview section in Google search results on desktop and mobile browsers</em></div>
  <details><summary>v1.0.9 release notes</summary><p>Visit the <a href="https://soitis.dev/ai-overview-hider-for-google" rel="nofollow">AI Overview Hider for Google website</a> for installation links, more information about the extension, and FAQs. Follow <a href="https://bsky.app/profile/soitis.dev" rel="nofollow">@soitis.dev</a> on Bluesky for updates.</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixed hiding AI Overview inline with other search results on desktop</li>
</ul>
